content.rendered:
Register now for our August Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be discussing the current status of the Salvage Market and new developments in this sector.

The webinar is scheduled for Thursday 13th August at 11am UK.

Commercial and operational developments had already placed the salvage sector in a state of change pre-COVID. The restrictions imposed during this health crisis have further modified activity, and the services available, the range of choices for those in need and potentially timeliness of support.

In this webinar:

  • We review the status of the market, identifying changes already seen or presaged prior to the COVID development, the current situation and potential future state
  • We examine the impact on salvage providers and on those requiring such services as Owners or Insurers
  • We also comment on the support services available to minimise the negative impact and continue to ensure efficient and successful outcomes

Jason Bennett, who will be delivering the main technical subject, started his career at sea before spending a number of years as a London based marine surveyor and consultant. Between 2005 and 2020 Jason worked directly in the salvage industry for leading global salvors. During this time he participated in many notable operations, leading teams in emergency response and wreck removal fields. He was also actively engaged in bodies helping shape the industry and its engagement with the wider sphere. Jason is an AqualisBraemar director based in the UK.

The session chairman will be Mark McGurran, Group MD of Marine Surveying & Consultancy, and the month’s casualty reports will be presented by Fena Boyle, surveyor, both from the London office.

If you wish to attend this webinar, click here to register.

excerpt.rendered: Register now for our August Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be discussing the current status of the Salvage Market and new developments in this sector.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: September Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our September Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be detailing first-hand experiences of our findings during ‘Shipshape©’ Risk Assessment Surveys.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: October Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Registration is now open for our October Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at the challenges arising from the Covid-19 pandemic and the consequences it has had for marine warranty surveys on current and future projects. The webinar is scheduled for Thursday…

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar - July Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register for our July Market Briefing for the maritime and maritime insurance sectors, our experts will be presenting on shiprepair & shipbuilding in Turkey, specifically the development of the shipyards in the Tuzla and Yalova area.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: December Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Registration is now open for our December Market Briefing Webinar for maritime and insurance professionals. Join our experts who will look at semi-submersible and Heavy Lift ships, focusing on design features, uses and risk factors.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Marine Casualty Market Briefing Webinar - Vessel Lay-up and Reactivation
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Join AqualisBraemar Marine experts for our Market Briefing webinar at 3:30pm GMT on Thursday 9th April 2020.

jetpack-related-posts.title: AqualisBraemar adds salvage expert to growing London team
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: We are delighted to announce that we have continued the process of strengthening our Marine team and service offerings to the P&I market with Jason Bennett joining the London team.
